intro: Knautia sylvatica, commonly known as the alpine knautia, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its foliage consists of serrated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Knautia sylvatica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
